title: Quasiperfect number
summary: In mathematics, a quasiperfect number is a natural number n for which the sum of all its divisors (the divisor function Ïƒ(n)) is equal to 2n + 1. Equivalently, n is the sum of its non-trivial divisors (that is, its divisors excluding 1 and n). No quasiperfect numbers have been found so far.
